heisig_chinese_memo: The farmer's almanac is like a brain that allows farmers to think of weather as a steady stream of changes, like the moon's behavior, instead of a violent ocean of surprises.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Without his brain Fagin wouldn't be able to get up to the cruelty  that he does.  It's the most important part of his body.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " meat " from " Chuan " from " skull ", the original meaning is the brain, the body in charge of motor and sensory organs of higher animals, is a major part of the nervous system. " Brain " is the same as "匘". "Said Wen": "匘, head 𩪦 also. From the dagger. The dagger, the dagger, the dagger, the shape is like a hair, and the shape is like a scorpion." Duan Yucai's note: "匘, the common is the brain." "Twenty-eight years of the public": "Meng Marquis of Jin fights with Chu Zi, and Chu Zi subdues himself and takes his brain."

" Brain " can refer to the head. "Huainanzi·Chuzhen": "The height of the cloud platform makes the fallen ones crush their heads."

" Brain " also refers to breaking the head. Han Zhang Heng's "Tokyo Fu": "Cut the snake, the brain is good." "Fang Liang" means the god of grass.

The central part of the object can also be called the " brain ". "Zhuziyu Lei" Volume 23: "(Apocalypse) is not that the star does not move, but the one in the head of the umbrella, who does not leave his place."

White things like brains or brains are also called " brains ". Ming Li Shizhen "Compendium of Materia Medica‧Muyi‧Dipterocarp": "Dipterocarp, found in all southern countries."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " meat " from " Chuan " from " skull ", the original meaning is the brain, the body in charge of motor and sensory organs of higher animals, is a major part of the nervous system.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，從「巛」，從「囟」，本義為腦髓，高等動物主管全身運動和感覺的器官，是神經系統的主要部分。「腦」同於「匘」。《說文》：「匘，頭𩪦也。从匕。匕，相匕著也，巛象髮，囟象匘形。」段玉裁注：「匘，俗作腦。」 《左傳‧僖公二十八年》：「晉侯夢與楚子搏，楚子伏己而盬其腦。」

　　「腦」可指頭顱。《淮南子‧俶真》：「雲台之高，墮者折脊碎腦。」

　　「腦」還指擊破頭部。漢張衡〈東京賦〉：「斬蜲蛇，腦方良。」「方良」意謂草澤之神。

　　物體的中心部分也可稱為「腦」。《朱子語類》卷23：「（極星）不是星全不動，是箇傘腦上一位子，不離其所。」

　　白色如腦狀或腦髓之物也叫做「腦」。明李時珍《本草綱目‧木一‧龍腦香》：「龍腦香，南番諸國皆有之。」
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，從「巛」，從「囟」，本義為腦髓，高等動物主管全身運動和感覺的器官，是神經系統的主要部分。

腦腦RS
脑脑 		脳 匘 brain
  • the brain 𡿺 of a man ⺼
  • ⓢ a man ⺼ who covers 亠 bad 凶 ideas and improves them uses his brain

(Simplified: 脑)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: An organ ⺼ in the skull 囟
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • ⿱ Above to below
      • 巛 [ chuān ] stream, river
      • 囟 [ xìn ] top of the head; skull
①高等動物神經系統的主要部分，在顱腔裏，主管感覺和運動。人腦又是思想記憶等心理活動的器官：腦髓。腦子(ａ．腦；b．指思考、記憶等能力)。腦筋。腦海。腦際。腦殼。腦顱。腦神經。腦下垂體。腦積水。腦溢血。電腦。
②頭：腦袋。腦殼。頭昏腦脹。腦滿腸肥。
③形狀或顏色像腦的東西：豆腐腦兒。
④指從物體中提煉出的精華部分：樟腦。薄荷腦。
腦海 [ nǎo hǎi ]: the mind; the brain
(Simplified: 脑)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: An organ ⺼ in the skull 囟
HSK: 1
Freq: 5633
Chinese: The farmer's almanac is like a brain that allows farmers to think of weather as a steady stream of changes, like the moon's behavior, instead of a violent ocean of surprises.
Meaning: brain
Hanzi: 脑
Story: Without his brain Fagin wouldn't be able to get up to the cruelty that he does. It's the most important part of his body.
Kind: traditional

從「 肉 」，從「 巛 」，從「 囟 」，本義為腦髓，高等動物主管全身運動和感覺的器官，是神經系統的主要部分。「 腦 」同於「 匘 」。《說文》：「匘，頭𩪦也。从匕。匕，相匕著也，巛象髮，囟象匘形。」段玉裁注：「匘，俗作腦。」 《左傳‧僖公二十八年》：「晉侯夢與楚子搏，楚子伏己而盬其腦。」 「 腦 」可指頭顱。《淮南子‧俶真》：「雲台之高，墮者折脊碎腦。」 「 腦 」還指擊破頭部。漢張衡〈東京賦〉：「斬蜲蛇，腦方良。」「方良」意謂草澤之神。 物體的中心部分也可稱為「 腦 」。《朱子語類》卷23：「（極星）不是星全不動，是箇傘腦上一位子，不離其所。」 白色如腦狀或腦髓之物也叫做「 腦 」。明李時珍《本草綱目‧木一‧龍腦香》：「龍腦香，南番諸國皆有之。」
From the " meat" from " Chuan" from " skull", the original meaning is the brain, the body in charge of motor and sensory organs of higher animals, is a major part of the nervous system. " Brain" is the same as " 匘". "Said Wen": "匘, head 𩪦 also. From the dagger. The dagger, the dagger, the dagger, the shape is like a hair, and the shape is like a scorpion." Duan Yucai's note: "匘, the common is the brain." "Twenty-eight years of the public": "Meng Marquis of Jin fights with Chu Zi, and Chu Zi subdues himself and takes his brain." " Brain" can refer to the head. "Huainanzi·Chuzhen": "The height of the cloud platform makes the fallen ones crush their heads." " Brain" also refers to breaking the head. Han Zhang Heng's "Tokyo Fu": "Cut the snake, the brain is good." "Fang Liang" means the god of grass. The central part of the object can also be called the " brain". "Zhuziyu Lei" Volume 23: "(Apocalypse) is not that the star does not move, but the one in the head of the umbrella, who does not leave his place." White things like brains or brains are also called " brains". Ming Li Shizhen "Compendium of Materia Medica‧Muyi‧Dipterocarp": "Dipterocarp, found in all southern countries."

腦字的基本解释

腦
nǎo
见“脑”。

腦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nǎo］
［《廣韻》奴晧切，上晧，泥。］
“脑1”的繁体字。
(1)高等动物主管全身运动和感觉的器官，是神经系统的主要部分。人脑还主管思维、记忆等活动。
(2)称能模拟或代替人脑进行某种活动的事物。
(3)头颅。
(4)谓击破头颅，脑浆溢出。引申指打击。
(5)物体的顶端、中心或边缘部分。
(6)指白色如脑状或脑髓之物。

腦字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　腦； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页988第20
【廣韻】奴皓切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】乃老切，?音惱。【說文】本作匘。頭髓也。　又【廣韻】那到切【集韻】乃到切，?音?。【廣韻】優皮也。【集韻】瀀澤也。　又【韻會】或作?。【周禮·冬官考工記·弓人】角之本蹙於?。　【廣韻】同堖。或从?。【集韻】或作??。

腦字的起名意思

暂无。

brain
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［nǎo］
["Guangyun" Slave cutting, upper sea, mud. ]
Traditional characters for "脑1".
(1) Higher animals are in charge of body movement and sensory organs, and are the main part of the nervous system. The human brain is also in charge of thinking, memory and other activities.
(2) It refers to things that can simulate or replace the human brain to perform certain activities.
(3) Head.
(4) It is said that when the head is broken, the brain plasma overflows. The extension refers to the blow.
(5) The top, center or edge part of the object.
(6) Refers to white things like brains or brains.
brain
